text: Mia Hansen-Løve (born 5 February 1981) is a movie director, screenwriter, and former actress from France. Her first feature movie, All Is Forgiven, won the Louis Delluc Prize for Best First Film in 2007 along with Céline Sciamma's Water Lilies. Hansen-Løve's movie Father of My Children won the Special Jury Prize in the Un Certain Regard section at the 2009 Cannes Film Festival. In 2014, Hansen-Løve was awarded the status of Chevalier in the Ordre des Arts et des Lettres. In 2016, she won the Silver Bear for Best Director for her movie Things to Come at the 66th Berlin International Film Festival, as well as becoming a member of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences. ==References== Category:1981 births Category:Living people Category:French screenwriters Category:French movie actors Category:French television actors Category:French stage actors Category:French voice actors Category:Actors from Paris Category:Writers from Paris Category:Movie directors from Paris
title: Mia Hansen-Løve
